featuredArticle.heading: Featured Article
featuredArticle.title: Understanding VAT for Dutch Businesses
featuredArticle.imageAlt: VAT calculation and filing for Dutch businesses
featuredArticle.intro: Value Added Tax (VAT), known as BTW in the Netherlands, is a crucial aspect of running a business in the Dutch market. Understanding the VAT system is essential for compliance and financial planning.

section1.title: VAT Rates in the Netherlands
section1.content: The Netherlands has three VAT rates that apply to different goods and services:

items.description: Applies to most goods and services
Applies to essential goods like food, books, medicines, and certain services
Applies to exports and certain international services

section2.title: VAT Filing Requirements
section2.content1: As a business owner in the Netherlands, you're required to file VAT returns periodically, typically quarterly. The Dutch Tax Authority (Belastingdienst) has specific deadlines and requirements for these filings.
section2.content2: Missing deadlines or incorrect filings can result in penalties, so it's important to maintain accurate records and understand your obligations.

section3.title: Common VAT Pitfalls to Avoid
section3.content: Many businesses encounter challenges with VAT compliance. Here are some common pitfalls to avoid:
items: Failing to register for VAT when required
Incorrectly classifying goods or services under the wrong VAT rate
Missing filing deadlines
Inadequate record-keeping for VAT purposes
Not accounting for international transactions correctly

featuredArticle.conclusion: Proper VAT management is essential for any business operating in the Netherlands. At Glodinas Finance, we help businesses navigate the complexities of the Dutch VAT system, ensuring compliance while optimizing your tax position.
featuredArticle.cta: Contact us for professional assistance with your VAT filings and tax planning

questions.question: What are your bookkeeping rates?
questions.answer: Our bookkeeping services start at €130 per month (excluding VAT) for ZZP'ers and €250 per month (excluding VAT) for BVs, including DGA payroll administration. The exact rate depends on the complexity and volume of your financial administration.

questions.question: How often will we communicate about my finances?
questions.answer: We provide monthly updates on your financial status, including profit and loss statements and cash flow reports. Additionally, we're available throughout the month for questions and consultations as needed.

questions.question: Can you help with business registration?
questions.answer: Yes, through our partnership with Firm24, we offer comprehensive business formation services, including registration with the Dutch Chamber of Commerce (KVK), VAT registration, and setting up the right legal structure for your business.

questions.question: Do you offer services in languages other than Dutch?
questions.answer: Yes, we offer our services in multiple languages, including Dutch, English, Romanian, Turkish, and Russian, to accommodate our diverse clientele.

questions.question: How do I transition my bookkeeping to Glodinas Finance?
questions.answer: Transitioning is simple. We handle the transition process, including gathering your financial history, setting up your accounts in our systems, and ensuring a smooth handover from your previous bookkeeper or accountant.

introduction.title: 1. Introduction
introduction.paragraph1: Glodinas Finance B.V. ("we," "our," or "us"), located at Schiphol Boulevard 127, Schiphol 1118 BG, Netherlands, is committed to protecting your privacy and personal data. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, disclose, and safeguard your information when you use our services, visit our website at www.glodinasfinance.nl, or otherwise interact with us.
introduction.paragraph2: We process personal data in accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and the Dutch Implementation Act (Uitvoeringswet AVG). This policy outlines your rights and our obligations regarding your personal data.

dataController.title: 2. Data Controller
dataController.paragraph: Glodinas Finance B.V. is the data controller responsible for your personal data:
dataController.address: Address: Schiphol Boulevard 127, Schiphol 1118 BG, Netherlands

personalData.title: 3. Personal Data We Collect
personalData.paragraph: We collect and process the following categories of personal data:

clientData.title: 3.1 Client Data
items: Identity information: name, title, date of birth, gender, nationality
Contact information: email address, telephone number, physical address
Business information: company name, job title, business sector, KVK number, VAT number
Financial information: bank account details, tax identification numbers, financial statements, income details, expense records
Service data: information about the services you use, account settings, preferences
Communication data: emails, letters, telephone calls, and other communications with us

websiteVisitorData.title: 3.2 Website Visitor Data
items: Technical data: IP address, browser type and version, time zone setting, browser plug-in types and versions, operating system and platform
Usage data: information about how you use our website, products, and services
Cookie data: information stored in cookies (see our Cookie Policy for details)
Contact form data: information you provide when using our contact forms

howWeCollect.title: 4. How We Collect Your Personal Data
howWeCollect.paragraph: We collect personal data through various channels:
items: Direct interactions: when you engage our services, create an account, fill in forms, or correspond with us
Automated technologies: when you visit our website, through cookies and similar technologies
Third parties: we may receive personal data from third parties such as business partners, subcontractors, payment providers, and publicly available sources

legalBasis.title: 5. Legal Basis for Processing
legalBasis.paragraph: We process your personal data on the following legal grounds:
items: Contract performance: Processing necessary for the performance of our contract with you or to take steps at your request before entering into a contract
Legal obligation: Processing necessary for compliance with our legal obligations (e.g., tax laws, anti-money laundering regulations)
Legitimate interests: Processing necessary for our legitimate interests or those of a third party, provided your interests and fundamental rights do not override those interests
Consent: Processing based on your specific consent

howWeUse.title: 6. How We Use Your Personal Data
howWeUse.paragraph: We use your personal data for the following purposes:

serviceProvision.title: 6.1 Service Provision
items: To provide bookkeeping, financial administration, and tax services
To manage your account and relationship with us
To process financial transactions and payments
To prepare financial statements, tax returns, and other financial documents
To communicate with you about our services

compliance.title: 6.2 Legal and Regulatory Compliance
items: To comply with legal and regulatory obligations, including tax laws and anti-money laundering regulations
To verify your identity and conduct due diligence checks
To maintain records as required by law

operations.title: 6.3 Business Operations
items: To improve our services and develop new offerings
To manage our business operations and administration
To ensure the security of our systems and prevent fraud
To analyze usage patterns and trends

marketing.title: 6.4 Marketing and Communications
items: To send you updates, newsletters, and information about our services (with your consent where required)
To invite you to events or webinars that may be of interest to you
To conduct satisfaction surveys and gather feedback

dataRetention.title: 7. Data Retention
dataRetention.paragraph1: We retain your personal data only for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes for which it was collected, including for the purposes of satisfying any legal, accounting, or reporting requirements.
dataRetention.paragraph2: For financial and tax-related data, we are required by Dutch law to retain records for at least 7 years. For other types of data, the retention period may vary based on the nature of the data and the purpose of processing.
dataRetention.paragraph3: When personal data is no longer needed, we will securely delete or anonymize it.

dataSharing.title: 8. Data Sharing and Transfers
dataSharing.paragraph1: We may share your personal data with the following categories of recipients:
recipients: Service providers: Third-party service providers who perform services on our behalf, such as IT providers, cloud storage providers, payment processors, and professional advisors
Regulatory authorities: Tax authorities, financial regulators, and other government bodies when required by law
Business partners: Partners with whom we offer co-branded services or joint marketing activities, with your consent where required
Professional advisors: Lawyers, bankers, auditors, and insurers who provide consultancy, banking, legal, insurance, and accounting services
dataSharing.paragraph2: We ensure that all third parties respect the security of your personal data and treat it in accordance with the law. We do not allow our third-party service providers to use your personal data for their own purposes.
dataSharing.paragraph3: When we transfer personal data outside the European Economic Area (EEA), we ensure a similar degree of protection by implementing at least one of the following safeguards:
safeguards: Transfers to countries that have been deemed to provide an adequate level of protection by the European Commission
Use of specific contracts approved by the European Commission (Standard Contractual Clauses)
Implementation of binding corporate rules for transfers within a corporate group

dataSecurity.title: 9. Data Security
dataSecurity.paragraph1: We have implemented appropriate security measures to prevent your personal data from being accidentally lost, used, or accessed in an unauthorized way, altered, or disclosed. These measures include:
measures: Staff training on data protection and security
dataSecurity.paragraph2: We have procedures to deal with any suspected personal data breach and will notify you and any applicable regulator of a breach where we are legally required to do so.

yourRights.title: 10. Your Rights
yourRights.paragraph1: Under the GDPR, you have the following rights regarding your personal data:
rights: Right to access: You can request a copy of the personal data we hold about you
Right to rectification: You can request correction of any inaccurate or incomplete personal data
Right to erasure: You can request deletion of your personal data in certain circumstances
Right to restrict processing: You can request restriction of processing of your personal data in certain circumstances
Right to data portability: You can request transfer of your personal data to you or a third party in a structured, commonly used, machine-readable format
Right to object: You can object to processing of your personal data in certain circumstances, particularly for direct marketing
Rights related to automated decision-making: You can request human intervention in automated decision-making and profiling
Right to withdraw consent: You can withdraw consent at any time where we rely on consent to process your personal data
yourRights.paragraph2: To exercise any of these rights, please contact us at cihatkaya@glodinas.nl. We will respond to your request within one month. There is no fee for exercising your rights, but we may charge a reasonable fee if your request is clearly unfounded, repetitive, or excessive.

cookies.title: 11. Cookies and Similar Technologies
cookies.paragraph1: Our website uses cookies and similar technologies to distinguish you from other users. This helps us provide you with a good experience when you browse our website and allows us to improve our site.
cookies.paragraph2: We use the following types of cookies:
cookieTypes: Strictly necessary cookies: Required for the operation of our website
Analytical/performance cookies: Allow us to recognize and count visitors and see how they move around our website
Functionality cookies: Used to recognize you when you return to our website
Targeting cookies: Record your visit to our website, the pages you visit, and the links you follow
cookies.paragraph3: You can set your browser to refuse all or some browser cookies or to alert you when websites set or access cookies. If you disable or refuse cookies, please note that some parts of our website may become inaccessible or not function properly.

childrenPrivacy.title: 12. Children's Privacy
childrenPrivacy.paragraph: Our services are not intended for children under 16 years of age, and we do not knowingly collect personal data from children. If you are a parent or guardian and believe we may have collected information about your child, please contact us immediately.

changes.title: 13. Changes to This Privacy Policy
changes.paragraph1: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time to reflect changes in our practices or for other operational, legal, or regulatory reasons. We will notify you of any material changes by posting the new Privacy Policy on this page and updating the "Last Updated" date.
changes.paragraph2: We encourage you to review this Privacy Policy periodically to stay informed about how we are protecting your personal data.

complaints.title: 14. Complaints
complaints.paragraph1: If you have concerns about how we handle your personal data, please contact us first at cihatkaya@glodinas.nl, and we will do our best to resolve your concerns.
complaints.paragraph2: You also have the right to lodge a complaint with the Dutch Data Protection Authority (Autoriteit Persoonsgegevens) if you believe that we have not complied with data protection laws. You can contact them at:

contactUs.title: 15. Contact Us
contactUs.paragraph: If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy or our data practices, please contact us at:

cta.title: Have Questions About Your Data?
cta.paragraph: Contact our data protection team for any questions or concerns about how we handle your personal information.
